page.title: 05STUDLAND TOURIST SURVEY
page.content: Children walked the length of Studland Beach interviewing the visitors.Most were from the Midlands or the home counties.Only 10 were on their first visit, having heard of the place from friends or guidebooks.Only 4 of the 40 people approached were staying in the village.The rest were day-trippers,staying in Swanage or other resorts.All approved of the quietness, the sandy beach, safe bathing, pretty village,scenic walks and lack of commercialisation. Most regarded carparking provision as good, amusements arcades and litter as undesirable and the local people as friendly and helpful.Gardens for "just sitting" were a good idea for some,but not more tea-rooms.Most thought prices in the village compared favourably with other resorts. {Over-all the {tourists we spoke to seemed satisfied.
